intro: Cephalomappa malloticarpa, commonly known as the white sand tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. The fruit is a small capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
